Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libhugetlbfs
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: libhugetlbfs bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The libhugetlbfs packages provide the library and utilities that are used to interact with the Linux hugetlbfs file system to make large pages available to applications in a transparent manner. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the hugeadm utility was not supposed to write to the /etc/mtab file, but did so. As a consequence, the following warning was returned: WARNING: Unable to add entry /var/lib/hugetlbfs/pagesize-2MB to /etc/mtab With this update, hugeadm no longer attempts to write to the aforementioned file, and hugeadm no longer returns any warnings. (BZ#1122597) Prior to this update, the libhugetlbfs packages did not build on the ppc64le platform. Consequently, users of ppc64le systems did not have libhugetlbfs available, which prevented other programs from working. With this update, libhugetlbfs has been updated to support the ppc64le platform, and the ppc64le systems users now have working libhugetlbfs packages. (BZ#1125576) Due to the wrong limit for the mmap() function call implied by low and high limit in the hugetlb_get_unmapped_area() function, running the libhugetlbfs testcase failed. The limit for the mmap() function has been exceeded, and all tests now pass successfully. (BZ#1161677) Users of libhugetlbfs are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
